Constructor Detail

MemoryPools

public MemoryPools()
Method Detail

bounded

public static MemoryPool bounded(long theSize)
Create a MemoryPool which has the specified hard limit on the amount of memory which can be allocated. This pool is allocated from the system pool.

Parameters:
theSize - the maximum amount of memory which can be allocated by the pool
Returns:
the pool
Throws:
NotEnoughMemoryException - if the system pool does not contain enough memory to allocate the pool

system

public static MemoryPool system()
Return the system MemoryPool; a bounded pool which contains the amount of memory specified by -XX:MaxDirectMemory, or when not specified, the default max directory memory allowed by the JVM. The system pool can be cleaned which will deallocate all allocated memory and free all child pools, but remain usable for future allocations.

Returns:
the system memory pool

systemChild

public static MemoryPool systemChild()

empty

public static MemoryPool empty()
Return an empty MemoryPool

Returns:
an empty pool
